page.title: 04Transport: bicycles
page.content: Many Children and adults have {cycles,} using them to travel fairly short distances to and from work, or for pleasure. Some people ride on three wheeled bikes called {tricycles.} A learner might have stabalizers fitted. People who work in a city where the roads are very crowded can carry a {fold up bicycle} in their car boot, park the car and then use the bicycle to travel more easily. Some children have {B.M.X bicycles} which are not meant to be ridden on the road but are used to do stunts and tricks or to race on rogh tracks. {Racing bicycles} are meant to be ridden on the roads which are kept clear of traffic while the race takes place. Cycle races also take place on special tracks either indoors or outdoors.
